page.title: 06Farming in Tavistock
page.content: Farming is important in the West Country because there is so much moorland and open space.It is good land to farm on because it is{good} { soil.}There are a lot of farms in and around Tavistock. There are{all sorts of farms:}meat farms, pig farms, wool farms, dairy farms and chicken farms. The land in some places is good for breeding cattle and some is good for farming cereals like barley and wheat. {* * * * * * * * * *} Most farmers use tractors nowadays and not horse power, and they use machinery in the dairies for milking the cows. In winter horses eat barley and the cows eat silage and the barley that is left over is dried and used for the animals' bedding.
